messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:

> JB, do you have more contacts than us? Could you do a little asking around?

I have spoken with Kent and we have talked about what would be in the
next release of JUnit. I have 3.8.2 right now, and I don't know whether
it's been released to the public -- the most visible change is better
highlighting of the differences between unequal strings. :)

Expected: ab[c]def, but was: ab[dr]def

The difference is in the brackets.

Opening the kimono, Kent invited me to be involved in JUnit 3.8.x and
JUnit 4.0, then asked me to do some code review for him, and I haven't
done it, mostly due to low motivation. For this reason I'm not too hard
on them for keeping things under wraps: if I were really so intent on
being involved, then I would do what they ask me to do, but since I
didn't, I don't complain. :)

> Failing that, perhaps this group could decide what it really wanted
> and then make the changes and release a 3.8.2? I mean, it's not like
> we don't have some of the finest testing brains on the planet around
> here (self _not_ included), not to mention some very strong opinions
> (ok, I'm in this category). Just a wild Friday afternoon kind of
> thought.

I strongly believe that even some of the best minds in this community
don't share the core philosophy of maintaining a small, closed
framework. For that reason, I'm not too keen on "opening it up". I don't
really trust myself with that, except for the fact that I've never
actually asked for an addition to JUnit. I just think more people need
to use the JUnit-addons test runner. That would satisfy quite a few of
them. :)
